title.narrative: Ukuthula Trust: Navigating a Path to Reviving Democracy in Zimbabwe 2021 - 2024
Ukuthula Trust: Navigating a Path to Reviving Democracy in Zimbabwe 2021 - 2024

description.narrative: The Ukuthula Trust seeks to achieve these broader objectives through the following objectives: Project Goal: To deepen democracy by empowering people to release their energy towards taking an active part in the development and governance of their communities, through rehabilitation of communities and through prevention of conflict in Zimbabwe in the future by generating knowledge and promoting accountability. 1. Deepening Democracy: To empower and promote poor and marginalized communities, especially women and youth, in a bid to increase local and national government transparency, accountability and responsiveness to those communities 2. Restoring Social Fabric and Rehabilitating Victims of Collective Violence: To improve community cohesion, including women and youth, so that all community members can actively participate in the development of their community. 3. Generating Knowledge: To actively promote the re-examining of concepts linked to democracy, youth, gender, development and the histories of violence in Zimbabwe. 4. Lobbying and Advocacy: To promote and influence policy change in Zimbabwe.

The Ukuthula Trust seeks to achieve these broader objectives through the following objectives:
Project Goal: To deepen democracy by empowering people to release their energy towards taking an active part in the development and governance of their communities, through rehabilitation of communities and through prevention of conflict in Zimbabwe in the future by generating knowledge and promoting accountability.
1. Deepening Democracy: To empower and promote poor and marginalized communities, especially women and youth, in a bid to increase local and national government transparency, accountability and responsiveness to those communities
2. Restoring Social Fabric and Rehabilitating Victims of Collective Violence: To improve community cohesion, including women and youth, so that all community members can actively participate in the development of their community.
3. Generating Knowledge: To actively promote the re-examining of concepts linked to democracy, youth, gender, development and the histories of violence in Zimbabwe.
4. Lobbying and Advocacy: To promote and influence policy change in Zimbabwe.

Ukuthula Trust försöker uppnå dessa bredare mål genom följande:
Projektmål: Att fördjupa demokratin genom att ge människor möjlighet att aktivt ta del i utvecklingen och styrningen av sina samhällen, genom rehabilitering av samhällen, och genom att förebygga framtida konflikter i Zimbabwe genom att generera kunskap och främja ansvarsskyldighet. 1. Fördjupad demokrati: Att stärka och främja fattiga och marginaliserade samhällen, med särskilt fokus på kvinnor och ungdomar, i ett försök att öka den lokala och nationella regeringens öppenhet, ansvarsskyldighet och lyhördhet för dessa samhällen.
2. Återställa social struktur och rehabilitera offer för kollektivt våld: Att förbättra samhällets sammanhållning, inklusive kvinnor och ungdomar, så att alla medlemmar i samhället aktivt kan delta i utvecklingen.
3. Skapa kunskap: Att aktivt främja omprövning av begrepp kopplade till demokrati, ungdom, kön, utveckling och historiskt våld i Zimbabwe.
4. Lobbying och påverkansarbete: Att främja och påverka politiska förändringar i Zimbabwe.

tag.narrative: 16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
The initiative is still in year one and no reports have been produced.
However, some immediate outputs reported by the partner through follow up include:
- Increased human rights awareness and provision of human rights information to community members. Community members are now more aware of their rights and converge to meet their duty bearers for engagement.
- Increase in income for household consumption in households that have benefited from horticultural projects implemented with support from Practical Action.
- Increased youth engagement through the use of vocational activities like sewing, baking and computers. Young people especially girls.
- Strengthened coordination of the Matabeleland Forum a grouping of civil society organisations from the region. Ukuthula is part of the Secretariat and ensures a well-coordinated and structured framework for civics in Bulawayo.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
